page.title: 13Gornal (1)
page.content: {Gornal}is in the{West Midlands.It}is{2 {miles west}of{Dudley.It}used to be part of{Sedgley}but is now in the {Metropolitan Borough of Dudley. { Gornal's}name is thought to have {originated}from{Quern}a{stone hand {mill}that used to{grind corn}from the {Stone Ages}to the{Medieval}times.The {local quarries}have{stone}which would have been{hard}enough for{grinding. { Gornal}is surrounded by place names ending in{ley-eg:Himley,Sedgley}and {Stickley.We}know that these must have been{clearings}in the{Saxon}like {Woodland. The{village}was small and quiet for many{years}but over the{last thirty {years new estates}have been{built}and the{population}has{increased.
